definition: (conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: As far as there is discernible regularity in the succession of phenomena, no recourse to statistics is needed.
sentences.chinese: 至於在現象的連續中有規則性可尋的，就用不著統計。

sentences.english: Lyotard considered that the core spirit of modern art is its ruleless.
sentences.chinese: 利奧塔認爲，現代藝術的核心精神便是它的無規則性。

sentences.english: Provide user with either regularity as in series, or novelty.
sentences.chinese: 向使用者呈現序列的規則性或者是新穎性。

sentences.english: The regularity of the crystal goes beyond this, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，晶體的規則性不止於此。

sentences.english: Blogging is the ultimate pursuit of personal freedom and irregularity at a high degree.
sentences.chinese: 也讓我們我們追求絕對的自由和高度的無規則性。
